accenture.name: Application Development Analyst - Accenture
accenture.description:
In the 1st project, I was assigned to understand a need of the SAP team and create a solution from scratch, including layout, frontend (React), backend (Node), database (Postgres) and infrastructure on AWS (EC2, S3 and RDS).
In the 2nd project, I'm acting as a React front-end technical lead. Our mission is to improve the accessibility of several websites of a large healthcare company in Brazil. This involves testing screen readers, color contrast, and other things described in WCAG standards. I help the team both in the development of tasks and in the organization of the project (Git Flow, Code Review, CI/CD Pipelines, Technical Refinement). It is important to point out that, although this is a front-end project, I have no intention of following this career. My focus is 90% backend and devops.

internIoasys.name: Full Stack Development Intern - Ioasys
internIoasys.description:
Participation in 2 development projects.
The last one, a Ruby on Rails API with infrastructure on AWS (EC2, RDS and S3 with video upload), was the biggest challenge, as in 2 weeks I had to take over the project's backend by myself, adding new clients such as Grupo Pardini and Suvinil and so I went for 3/4 months until the end of my contract with Ioasys.
The penultimate, a Node Serverless project on AWS, was an authentication integration that uses the SAML standard to connect a customer's users with a company product.
